result.execSummary:
The defendant Divontae L Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Divontae L Young

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 31 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($253) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

   If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with Burlington Coat Factory or any witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Divontae L Young in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joseph Smith.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
8 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
31 Days Credit.
STAYED.
  

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Burlington Coat Factory or any witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
DNA Sample if not already provided.

Costs: $243
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Defendant can be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: July 6, 2015.
Defendant to have no contact with Burlington Coat Factory or any witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
